roles.committee: Senate Committee on Global Warming and Climate Change
Joint Committee on Health Care Financing

cosponsorship.title: An Act to improve the Commonwealth’s economy with a strong minimum wage and a strong tipped minimum wage
cosponsorship.description: Raises minimum wage to $15 by 2021 and indexes it to inflation. Ensures that tipped employees’ wages plus tips equal the new strengthened minimum wage.

cosponsorship.title: An Act to improve the Commonwealth’s economy with a strong minimum wage and a strong tipped minimum wage
cosponsorship.description: Raises minimum wage to $15 by 2021 and indexes it to inflation. Ensures that tipped employees’ wages plus tips equal the new strengthened minimum wage.

cosponsorship.title: An Initiative Petition for an Amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth to Provide Resources for Education and Transportation through an additional tax on incomes in excess of One Million Dollars (Fair Share Amendment)
cosponsorship.description: Creates a 4% surtax on income above $1 million (inflation-adjusted) to fund education and transportation investment.

cosponsorship.title: An Act establishing a paid family and medical leave insurance program (Gordon-Spilka)
cosponsorship.description: Makes employees eligible for job-protected paid leave to recover from a serious illness or injury, to care for a seriously ill or injured family member, or to care for a new child.

cosponsorship.title: An Act establishing a paid family and medical leave insurance program (Gordon-Spilka)
cosponsorship.description: Makes employees eligible for job-protected paid leave to recover from a serious illness or injury, to care for a seriously ill or injured family member, or to care for a new child.

cosponsorship.title: An Act promoting housing and sustainable development
cosponsorship.description: Upgrades state’s zoning laws to encourage more affordable housing and transit-oriented, walkable development and promotes inclusionary zoning practices.

cosponsorship.title: An Act establishing Medicare for All in Massachusetts
cosponsorship.description: Establishes a single payer system, in which the state provides health care to all residents as a right.

cosponsorship.title: An Act establishing Medicare for All in Massachusetts
cosponsorship.description: Establishes a single payer system, in which the state provides health care to all residents as a right.

cosponsorship.title: An Act modernizing the Foundation Budget for the 21st century
cosponsorship.description: Requires the state to implement the recommendations of the the 2015 Foundation Budget Review Commission on K-12 education.

cosponsorship.title: An Act making public higher education in Massachusetts free for residents of the state
cosponsorship.description: Establishes free college tuition and fees for all Massachusetts residents.

cosponsorship.title: An Act promoting access to debt-free public higher education
cosponsorship.description: Establishes free college (community college and/or state university) education for students of all families earning $200,000 a year or less, covering tuition, fees, housing, and transportation costs.

cosponsorship.title: An Act for justice reinvestment
cosponsorship.description: Enacts comprehensive justice reform, complementing reductions in sentencing with jobs training, youth jobs, and pre-apprenticeship programs.

cosponsorship.title: An Act for justice reinvestment
cosponsorship.description: Enacts comprehensive justice reform, complementing reductions in sentencing with jobs training, youth jobs, and pre-apprenticeship programs.

cosponsorship.title: An Act to eliminate mandatory minimum sentences related to drug offenses
cosponsorship.description: Restores judicial discretion in sentencing for nonviolent drug charges, reducing the economic and social costs of extended prison terms.

cosponsorship.title: An Act to eliminate mandatory minimum sentences related to drug offenses
cosponsorship.description: Restores judicial discretion in sentencing for nonviolent drug charges, reducing the economic and social costs of extended prison terms.

cosponsorship.title: An Act to protect the civil rights and safety of all Massachusetts residents (“Safe Communities Act”)
cosponsorship.description: Prohibits the use of state resources for mass deportations or deportation raids, limits local and state police collaboration with federal immigration agents, and prohibits state support for Muslim registry.

cosponsorship.title: An Act to protect the civil rights and safety of all Massachusetts residents (“Safe Communities Act”)
cosponsorship.description: Prohibits the use of state resources for mass deportations or deportation raids, limits local and state police collaboration with federal immigration agents, and prohibits state support for Muslim registry.

cosponsorship.title: An Act to reduce the criminalization of poverty
cosponsorship.description: Eliminates or reduces numerous fees, such as parole supervision, and ensures indigent residents are not jailed or given unreasonable fees simply because they struggle to pay court-related fine.

cosponsorship.title: An Act to reduce the criminalization of poverty
cosponsorship.description: Eliminates or reduces numerous fees, such as parole supervision, and ensures indigent residents are not jailed or given unreasonable fees simply because they struggle to pay court-related fine.

cosponsorship.title: An Act relative to advancing contraceptive coverage and economic security in our state (ACCESS)
cosponsorship.description: Updates MA’s contraceptive coverage equity law to require insurance carriers to provide all contraceptive methods without a copay.

cosponsorship.title: An Act relative to advancing contraceptive coverage and economic security in our state (ACCESS)
cosponsorship.description: Updates MA’s contraceptive coverage equity law to require insurance carriers to provide all contraceptive methods without a copay.

cosponsorship.title: An Act automatically registering eligible voters and enhancing safeguards against fraud
cosponsorship.description: Modernizes voter registration by automatically registering citizens who interact with government agencies and ensures that such information is handled in a secure fashion

cosponsorship.title: An Act automatically registering eligible voters and enhancing safeguards against fraud
cosponsorship.description: Modernizes voter registration by automatically registering citizens who interact with government agencies and ensures that such information is handled in a secure fashion

cosponsorship.title: An Act creating 21st Century Massachusetts clean energy jobs
cosponsorship.description: Establishes a climate adaptation and management program, sets greenhouse gas reduction targets for 2030 and 2040, accelerates the state’s Renewable Portfolio Standard (RPS), and increases commitment to offshore wind.

cosponsorship.title: An Act relative to solar power and the green economy
cosponsorship.description: Accelerates the state’s commitment to clean energy (RPS increase) and sets 25% by 2030 solar target.

cosponsorship.title: An Act relative to solar power and the green economy
cosponsorship.description: Accelerates the state’s commitment to clean energy (RPS increase) and sets 25% by 2030 solar target.

cosponsorship.title: An Act clarifying authorities and responsibilities of the Department of Public Utilities
cosponsorship.description: Holds gas companies to high standard with regards to new infrastrucure and prevents massive public subsidy of new interstate gas pipelines.

cosponsorship.title: An Act clarifying authorities and responsibilities of the Department of Public Utilities
cosponsorship.description: Holds gas companies to high standard with regards to new infrastrucure and prevents massive public subsidy of new interstate gas pipelines.

cosponsorship.title: An Act to promote green infrastructure, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and create jobs
cosponsorship.description: Enacts revenue-positive carbon pricing. 80% is rebated to residents while 20% is invested in green infrastructure, with a carve-out for low-income communities.

cosponsorship.title: An Act combating climate change
cosponsorship.description: Enacts revenue-neutral carbon pricing. Every state resident receives an equal rebate, and employers get rebates based on their number of employees.

votes.title: Expand Earned Income Tax Credit and Increase Personal Exemptions
votes.description: Vote would increase the Earned Income Tax Credit and the personal tax exemption. The EITC is an effective means of providing assistance to low-income households.

votes.title: Earned Sick Time Implementation Delay
votes.description: Vote was to delay the implementation of Earned Sick Time for workers, a law which was passed by the voters on the 2014 ballot.

votes.title: Abolishing the Death Tax
votes.description: Vote would abolish the estate tax, one of the most progressive forms of taxation, and a source of revenue for the Commonwealth.

votes.title: Providing for a Private Sector-Funded Olympics
votes.description: Vote would have explicitly prohibited state funding for the proposed Boston 2024 Olympic Games. Public monies should not be used to fund private events that primarily benefit corporations.

votes.title: Reducing youth consumption of flavored cigars
votes.description: Vote was on applying the same tax to flavored cigars as is currently imposed on cigarettes, closing a corporate loophole.

votes.title: Conference Committee Report to FY16 State Budget
votes.description: Vote on the Conference Committee report of the FY16 state budget, which included a suspension of the Taxpayers Protection Act (aka "Pacheco law"), which requires an audit of the privatizaton of government services, for the MBTA. This vote was an opportunity for Senators to express their opposition to the privatization of the MBTA.

votes.title: An Act establishing a sales tax holiday in 2015
votes.description: Vote would establish a two-day sales tax holiday during Aug. 2015, reducing state revenue by approximately $50 million, with dubious economic benefits.

votes.title: An Act clearing titles to foreclosed properties
votes.description: Vote was to allow foreclosed homeowners to live in foreclosed homes, paying fair market rent to the bank, to ensure the family has a place to live and the property is not vacant, protecting area property values.

votes.title: An Act clearing titles to foreclosed properties
votes.description: Vote was to allow banks to clear titles of illegally foreclosed homes, and limit wrongly foreclosed homeowners' ability to sue banks that illegally foreclosed their homes. Bill benefits big banks and title insurance companies, at the expense of often financially struggling former homeowners.

votes.title: An Act relative to motor vehicle license suspension
votes.tags: Criminal Justice, Jobs, War on Drugs
votes.description: This vote repeals the law that automatically suspends drivers' licenses from persons convicted of drug crimes. It also removes the $500 fine for license reinstatement. Loss of driving privileges creates barriers to employment and successful re-entry into the community. Fines and fees disproportionately impact low-income persons and communities of color.

votes.title: An Act relative to enhanced enforcement of civil penalties
votes.description: This bill allows the Attorney General to represent workers affected by wage theft, who would otherwise be unlikely to afford legal counsel.

votes.title: Opt in
votes.description: Vote requires school districts, students, and educators to each opt-in to sex education, acting as a religious exemption for the educator. Students under the original Senate bill already have the right to opt out. Amendment, if passed, would have reduced the number of students receiving comprehensive health education.

votes.title: An Act relative to healthy youth
votes.description: Vote requires any sexual health education by school districts, public schools and charter schools to be (1) medically accurate and (2) age-appropriate, as well as mandates notification to parents/guardians, with the option to withdraw the child.

votes.title: Cost Effectiveness
votes.description: Vote was on requiring "cost-effectiveness" to be considered in the development of a plan to meet Global Warming Solutions Act emissions targets for 2030 and 2040. At best, the amendment would duplicate existing language in the bill. At worst, it would weaken climate mitigation plans.

votes.title: Expanding Educational Opportunity
votes.description: Vote was on rapidly expanding charter schools in the state by authorizing up to 12 additional Commmonwealth charter schools per year. Charter schools already siphon $450 million from public schools each year. The proposal offered no funding source for the authorized schools nor any new accountability measures for charter schools.

votes.title: Local Control
votes.description:
Vote was on giving local school committees the power to vote on whether a charter school in their district should receive local education funding. Currently, the state can authorize charter schools against the wishes of a school district and the local community, siphoning away money from the district. Under the amendment, if there is no local approval, the state would provide the funding.
(Roll Call #272, Bill S.2203, Amdt. 1, 4/7/16. Progressive Position: YES )
.

votes.title: Improper Use Penalties II
votes.description: Vote was an attempt to sow confusion around the transgender accommodations law and its enforcement by redundantly criminalizing acts of trespassing, attempting to prey upon toxic stereotypes about transgender persons, with no relation to reality.

votes.title: Exemption for multiple capacity locker rooms and showers
votes.description: Vote was on allowing for discrimination against transgender individuals in multiple-capacity showers and locker rooms, continuing toxic stereotypes that have no basis in reality.

votes.title: An Act relative to transgender anti-discrimination
votes.description: Vote was on guaranteeing equal access to public places for all regardless of gender identity.

votes.title: Fair Share amendment
votes.description: Vote on the the Fair Share Amendment, which would create a surtax on income above $1 million, with the revenue earmarked for education and transportation spending. A progressive income tax would make sure that millionaires (and billionaires) are contributing their fair share to much-needed investments.

votes.title: Gender equity in the purchasing of insurance policies
votes.description: Vote was on prohibiting insurance companies from charging different rates for disability insurance on the basis of gender.

votes.title: Plastic Bag Reduction
votes.description: Vote was on banning the use of single-use carryout plastic bags.

votes.title: Discretionary Imposition of Probation Fees and Victim Services Surcharges on Probationers
votes.description: Vote was on preventing the failure to pay probation-related fees from counting as a violation of probation, and on making such fees optional, by discretion of the court.

votes.title: Clarifying the Limit on MBTA Fare Increases
votes.description: Vote was on capping MBTA fare hikes to 5 percent over a 24-month period.

votes.title: REAL ID
votes.description: Vote was on creating a two-tiered state ID system, one that is compliant with strict fedreal REAL ID requirements and one that is not. Transgender individuals, the elderly, the young, the disabled, the transient, the homeless, immigrants, and low-income people of color have historically faced hurdles in providing adequate documentation for IDs and licenses, a problem exacerbated by the REAL ID requirements.

votes.title: Relative to accessory dwelling units
votes.description: Vote was on allowing accessory dwelling units (accessory apartments built by single family home owners) to be counted as affordable under Chapter 40B, thereby reducing the amount of affordable housing towns are required to have.

votes.title: An Act promoting housing and sustainable development
votes.description: Vote was on upgrading Massachusetts’s zoning laws to encourage more affordable housing and transit-oriented, walkable development and on allowing municipalities to adopt inclusionary zoning practices.

votes.title: Elimination of the Municipal Transportation Infrastructure Trust Fund
votes.description: Vote was on striking the provision of the underlying bill that would require transportation network companies (Uber, Lyft, etc.) to pay a tax of 20-cents per ride into a new Municipal Transportation Infrastructure Trust Fund, which would provide financial assistance to small businesses operating in the taxicab, livery, or hackney industries and to cities and towns to address the impact of TNCs on municipal roads and bridges.

votes.title: An Act promoting transparency, best practices, and better outcomes for children and communities
votes.description: Vote was on diverting youth with low-level offenses from going deeper into the criminal justice system.

votes.title: Regional Transportation Ballot Initiatives
votes.description: Vote was on enabling municipalities to place a question on the ballot to raise revenue for local and regional transportation projects.

votes.title: An act relative to family financial protection
votes.description: Vote was on providing greater protections and relief for consumers who are pursued by abusive debt collectors.

votes.title: Direct Company Liability Standard
votes.description: Vote was on limiting the liability threshold for holding companies accountable in cases of wage theft violations by contractors.

votes.title: An act relative to disclosure of top contributors for independence expenditures or electioneering communications
votes.description: Vote was on requiring direct mailings and billboards to list the top five donors with contributions over $5,000 when a group buys a political ad.

votes.title: Tax Expenditure Review
votes.description: Vote was on requiring any proposal to offer corporate tax incentives have sunset and other accountability provisions so that so that corporations do not have unchecked and unlimited subsidies at the expense of taxpayers and much-needed investments.

votes.title: Angel Investment Tax Credit
votes.description: Vote was on expanding tax incentives for investing in newly formed startups. Although small business growth is a valuable aim, the bill reduces public revenue, perpetuating the problem of chronic underinvestment in our social priorities.

votes.title: Lottery Online Products
votes.description: Vote was on authorizing online lottery sales. Lotteries disproportionately target low- and moderate-income individuals and are thus a regressive source of revenue.

votes.title: Transient Accommodation
votes.description: Vote was on exempting primary residences and houses rented out for less than three weeks per year from the tax on short-term rentals in the underlying bill. The amendment would undermine the effort to close the tax loophole exploited by companies like Airbnb.

votes.title: Economic Development in the Commonwealth
votes.description: Vote was on allowing the wider use of "independent contractor" status in the creative economy, which would lead to fewer workplace benefits and protections.

roles.committee: Joint Committee on Municipalities and Regional Government
Joint Committee on Consumer Protection and Professional Licensure
House Committee on Post Audit and Oversight

votes.title: Tax Roll Call
votes.description: Vote on House rules would have required a 2/3 majority to increase taxes, creating a very high threshold to raise revenue for the Commonwealth.

votes.title: Term Limits for Speaker
votes.tags: Good Gov't., Democracy, Rules Reform: Leadership
votes.description: This vote on House rules would have retained term limits for the position of Speaker of the House, one of few checks on the vast power of the position. (With this vote, there is now no term limit for the Speaker of the House).

votes.title: Treble Damages
votes.description: Vote would have repealed a 2008 law where workers, when denied their wages, are compensated by employers' payment of 3x their wages. This is an important worker protection, disincentivizing employers from wage theft.

votes.title: Further to 575
votes.description: Vote was to send to study an amendment (575) that would prohibit mixed-status immigrant families from living in public housing.

votes.title: Earned Sick Time Date Change
votes.description: Vote was to delay the implementation of Earned Sick Time for workers, a law which was passed by the voters on the 2014 ballot.

votes.title: Correctional / Prisoners Legal Services
votes.description: Vote was to override the Governor's veto of increased funding for prisoner legal services.

votes.title: UMASS Veto override
votes.description: Vote was to override the Governor's veto of increased funding for the UMass higher education system.

votes.title: Mass. Rental Voucher Program
votes.description: Vote was to override the Governor's veto of increased funding for the Massachusetts Rental Voucher Program (MRVP), to provide affordable housing to low-income families.

votes.title: Birth through Preschool
votes.description: Vote was to override the Governor's veto of increased funding for early childhood education programs.

votes.title: Sales Tax holiday
votes.description: Vote would establish a two-day sales tax holiday during Aug. 2015, reducing state revenue by approximately $50 million, with dubious economic benefits.

votes.title: Further to 3
votes.description: Vote was to send to study an amendment establishing a mandatory minimum sentence for trafficking fentanyl. Mandatory minimum sentences for drug-related crimes have a disproportionate impact on minority communities, contribute to prison overcrowding and costs, and are not effective deterrents to crime.

votes.title: Clear Title to Property
votes.description: Vote was to allow banks to clear titles of illegally foreclosed homes, and limit wrongly foreclosed homeowners' ability to sue banks that illegally foreclosed their homes. Bill benefits big banks and title insurance companies, at the expense of often financially struggling former homeowners.

votes.title: Providing for the establishment of a comprehensive adaptation management plan in response to climate change
votes.description: This vote (the House "solar netmetering bill") reduces the netmetering rates for solar owners, cuts subsidies for solar installed on affordable housing and community solar, and eliminates grandfathering of the net metering rate of current solar installations. This bill moves MA away from a progressive energy policy, aggressively combating climate change, and supporting solar industry jobs.

votes.title: An Act relative to motor vehicle license suspension
votes.tags: Criminal Justice, Jobs, War on Drugs
votes.description: This vote repeals the law that automatically suspends drivers' licenses from persons convicted of drug crimes. It also removes the $500 fine for license reinstatement. Loss of driving privileges creates barriers to employment and successful re-entry into the community. Fines and fees disproportionately impact low-income persons and communities of color.

votes.title: 612 further
votes.description:
Vote was on defeating a proposal to roll back the sales tax to 5% by sending it to study. Rolling back the sales tax would have reduced state revenue and led to future budget cuts and a continuation of chronic underinvestment in social priorities. 
(Roll Call #222, Bill H4200, Amdt 612.1,  4/25/16, Progressive Position: YES)
.

votes.title: Secure Funding for Secure Communities
votes.description: Vote was on banning towns from receiving government aid if they refuse to cooperate with the federal anti-immigrant Secure Communities program. The bill could harm immigrant families across the Commonwealth and make communities less safe by discouraging people from reporting crimes out of fear for themselves and their families.

votes.title: Section 12J Violation Funding Prohibition
votes.description: Vote was on banning state money from going to organizations that experiment on human fetuses. The amendment was designed as an attack on Planned Parenthood.

votes.title: Fair Share Amendment
votes.description: Vote on the the Fair Share Amendment, which would create a surtax on income above $1 million, with the revenue earmarked for education and transportation spending.

votes.title: Exemption for multiple capacity showers and locker rooms
votes.description: Vote was on allowing for discrimination against transgender individuals in multiple-capacity showers and locker rooms, continuing toxic stereotypes that have no basis in reality.

votes.title: Gender identity amendment
votes.description: Vote was an attempt to sow confusion around the transgender accommodations law and its enforcement by redundantly criminalizing acts of trespassing, attempting to prey upon toxic stereotypes about transgender persons, with no relation to reality.

votes.title: An act relative to disclosure of top contributors for independence expenditures or electioneering communications
votes.description: Vote was on requiring direct mailings and billboards to list the top five donors with contributions over $5,000 when a group buys a political ad.

votes.title: An act relative to transgender discrimination
votes.description: Vote was on accepting the Conference Committee report on the transgender rights bill, which would guarantee equal access to public places for all regardless of gender identity.

votes.title: Governor's amendment to An act relative to the federal REAL ID law
votes.description: Vote was on prohibiting undocumented immigrants from obtaining state-issued IDs and creating additional hurdles for documented immigrants to do so.
